original: Kuller, Gustaf Oscar, civilingenjör, Nässjö, f. 28/10/89 i Gbg av ing. Oscar K. o. Amelie Strandberg. G. 16 m. Rut Bogren. Barn: Nils-Erik f. 17, civil-ing., Marianne 20, g. m. järnhandl. A. Gradén, Varberg. — Avg:ex. fr. CTH (maskinbyggn. o. mek. teknol.) 12. Konstr. v. A-B Kväveind. 13-14, v. Gbgs gasverk 15, chef f. ritkont. o. kalkylavd. v. Lindeils vågfabr. A-B 16 -18, ritkont :chef v. Sv. Metallverken i Västerås 18-20, driftsing. där 21-27, chefsing. f. valsverken 28-32. Stat. justerare i Upps. 1. 27, i Kopparb. 1. 32, i Södermani. 1. 36, i Nässjö distr. fr. 40. V. ordf. i fören. Stat. jusiterare av mått o. vikt fr. 38.
translated: Kuller, Gustaf Oscar, civil engineer, Nässjö, born on October 28, 1889 in Gothenburg, son of engineer Oscar K. and Amelie Strandberg. Married on June 16 with Rut Bogren. Children: Nils-Erik, born in 1917, civil engineer, and Marianne, born in 1920, married to ironmonger A. Gradén from Varberg. Education: Graduated from Chalmers University of Technology (mechanical engineering) in 1912. Worked as a designer at A-B Kväveindustrier from 1913 to 1914, at Gothenburg Gasworks in 1915, as head of drawing office and calculation department at Lindeils Scale Factory A-B from 1916 to 1918, as head of drawing office at Swedish Metalworks in Västerås from 1918 to 1920, as chief engineer there from 1921 to 1927, and as chief engineer at the rolling mills from 1928 to 1932. State adjuster in Uppsala from 1927, in Kopparberg from 1932, in Södermanland from 1936, and in the Nässjö district from 1940. Vice chairman of the Association for State Adjusters of Weights and Measures from 1938.

work.namedPosition: Head of Drawing Office and Calculation Department

memberOf.name: Association for State Adjusters of Weights and Measures
